Kim Jong-min

Introduction

Kim Jong-min is a South Korean singer, dancer and television personality. He has been a member of the group Koyote since 2000 and a cast member of the variety show 2 Days & 1 Night since 2007.

Before debuting as a member of Koyote, Kim worked as a backup dancer for Uhm Jung Hwa, Lee Jung Hyun, Kim Wan Sun, R.E.F and many other artists.

Kim replaced Cha Seung-min as a temporary serve vocalist for Koyote in October 2000. They promoted "Disturbance" in January 2001, with various remixes. The song eventually rose to first place nominee on Music Bank and consecutively won for 2 weeks. They also promoted "Pride" for a week. Right after their promotions ended, Kim Jong-min left the group. He returned in October and became a regular member.
In the first quarter of 2011, he released his very first single entitled "Oppa Find Strength".

He made his solo comeback on September 3, 2014, as he released his third single, "Sali Go Dali Go", an electronic dance music composed by DanDi. The music video featured Chun Myung-hoon (NRG) and comedian Ahn Young-mi. His new track peaked at ranking number eight on China's popular music video-sharing site, Yinyuetai.
